column1: A colossal tower with no visible entrance or windows, topped by a minaret.
A steep canyon, its walls covered with hanging buildings.
Rubble-covered terrain, as far as the eye can see. The only remains of what once must have been a large city.
A large dome, covering the ruins of some sort of square.
A multi-leveled road system, criss-crossed a hundred different ways.
A series of arches rising above the rubble.
A pair of tall skyscrapers creating an artificial valley.
A wide, circular plaza, stairs spiraling downwards to a collapsed underground facility.
A wide avenue, surprisingly free of rubble, with low, square buildings at each side.
A series of pools, in neat rows of three, extending for miles into the distance.
